the number of stitches required for the hat s circumference it seems fitting given that this the sample hat was knitted in rauma design was made for love of canada finullgarn 175 m/50 g rnds 1-24 skulls and maple leaves should be the pompom used an extra 42 m/46 worked as follows work the first 13 sts of the chart yards of the contrast colour then work 4 reps of the sts outlined in green 1 repeat = 30 sts 4 reps = 120 sts finish by working the last 11 sts of the chart for this section i found stitchmarkers to be very helpful needles 2 5 mm/ us 1 5 circular needle 50 cm to avoid jogs uneven stripes at the beginning of 3 mm / us 2 5 circular needle 50 cm rounds i use this jogless join method 3 mm / us 2 5 double-pointed needles toque gauge with mc cast on 140 sts on smaller needles place 15 sts x 16 row = 5 cm/2 over chart 1 marker and join in a round work k2p2 rib until piece with larger needles measures 3 cm/1 25 from cast-on edge k the next round increasing 4 sts evenly spaced = 144 sts finished measurements change to larger needles and work chart 1 = 120 height 20 cm/8 sts after round 31 96 sts after round 36 72 sts after circumference 51cm/20 round 42 8 sts after
